segments.text: I can't believe she hasn't noticed the sink overflowing yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is already forming a puddle around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, polishing that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the drain is clogged or if she forgot to turn it off.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is going to be a mess to clean up later.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the kids are completely ignoring it too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’re too busy trying to sneak cookies to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she realizes what’s happening before the whole kitchen floods.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is already dripping down the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is just asking for trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR
